marginalia.translation: Whatever is not enough is never too much.

position.marginalia_text: Inuictus est, qui quatuor virtutibus amictus

marginalia.translation: Unconquerable is he who is clothed in the four virtues.

position.marginalia_text: Fortuna sedens Apellis: nunq[uam] enim stetit.

marginalia.translation: The fortune of Apelles is seated, and indeed it never stands.

position.marginalia_text: Bona Ethica, et Oeconomica faciunt bonam Politicam. Cum Socratis aureo ingenio.

marginalia.translation: Good ethics and economics make good politics. Together with the golden genius of Socrates.

position.marginalia_text: Virtus currens Apellis: nunq[uam] enim sedit: stet raro.

marginalia.translation: The virtue of Apelles is running, and indeed it never sits. Rarely will it stand up.
The declared goal of Cicero, to be the best of all men. Just as the goal of Cicero is to be the first among all men.

position.marginalia_text: Nemo vnq[uam] satis prudens, aut fortis fuit: aut quod tertium est, satis dulcis: quem nihil perturbaret, aut offenderet, quicquid accideret turbarum. [R]am industria, effectus est prudentia[e], et fortitudinis:

marginalia.translation: No one was every prudent or strong enough (or sweet enough which is the third option), whom nothing would have bothered or offended if some turmoil had occurred. The

position.marginalia_text: { Gulielmi Birdi dictum de Axiophilo. Illum hominem nunq[uam] vidi iratum; nunq[uam]

marginalia.translation: The saying of William Bird regarding Axiophilus. I never saw that man angry, never [-]

position.marginalia_text: The archphilosopher: archphysician: archlawier: arch[??]: archconducter at land, or sea.
